Used in approvals.","params":{"operator":"Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner."}}],"ERC1155InvalidReceiver(address)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the token `receiver`. balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOfBatch}. Requirements: - `accounts` and `ids` must have the same length.

checkInWhitelist(address,bytes32[]).details: Checks if an address is whitelisted.

returns._0: A boolean indicating whether the address is whitelisted.

constructor.details: Constructor to initialize the ERC1155-based activity.

params.activityStart: Delay in hours from the current block timestamp after which the activity starts.
params.hoursAvailable: Duration of the activity in hours.
params.supply: Total supply of the ERC1155 tokens for the activity.

getActivityStart().details: Returns the start time of the activity.

returns._0: The start time of the activity.

getHoursAvailable().details: Returns the hours available for the activity.

returns._0: The hours available for the activity.

getMerkleRoot().details: Returns the Merkle root for whitelist verification.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setMerkleRoot(bytes32).details: Sets the Merkle root for whitelist verification.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

uri(uint256).details: See {IERC1155MetadataURI-uri}. This implementation returns the same URI for *all* token types. It relies on the token type ID substitution mechanism https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1155#metadata[defined in the ERC]. Clients calling this function must replace the `\{id\}` substring with the actual token type ID.

withdrawPrize(address,bytes32[]).details: Allows a whitelisted address to withdraw a prize.

params.proof: Merkle proof to verify the whitelist.
